intro: Piptomeris angulata, commonly known as the angular spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves with a distinctive angular appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Piptomeris angulata is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological adaptations.
